intro: Lepidium virginicum var. centrali-americanum, commonly known as the central American peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and open habitats. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
